700575f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, north from and including Lake View Place, showing, under construction, the bridge for the new Henry Hudson Parkway which runs
perpendicular to and over Broadway.
July 13, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
July 18, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A portion of the same, showing construction of an approach to the parkway,on the west side of Broadway,at West 253rd Street.
July 18, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
700575f-b.folder: Broadway & Lake View Place, Bronx, NY

701395f.text:
Lakeview Place, west from Broadway to Post Road, showing W.P.A. laborers doing pavement repair work. In the right background is
visible the Riverdale Country School.
December 14, 1936.
Works Progress Administration.
Federal Art Project photo.
701395f.folder: Lake View Place & Broadway, Bronx, NY

700574f-a.text:
Broadway, (extreme left) north from Lakeview Place, showing the Henry Hudson Parkway bridge spanning it. In the foreground is an approach
to the parkway from the east side of Broadway.
April 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
700574f-a.folder: Broadway & Lake View Place, Bronx, NY

701396f-b.text:
(1)
lake View Place, west from Bradway to Post Road. The houses, at the head of Lake View Place are on the west side of
Post Road.
Aprii 23, 1935
P.L.Sperr
(2)
The same, at a later date. W. P.A. isn are shown repaving
the street.
Jan. 6, 1937

700573f-a.text:
Broadway, at the N.W. corner of Lake View Place. Iu the right background appears the fenced-in area of the Riverdale Gounty School.
April 23, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
